HexadecimalLiteralCheck.description: Checks the letter case of hexadecimal literals.

props.description: Checks the letter case of hexadecimal literals.

option.description:
policy for hexadecimal literals
	    - upperCase = use uppercase for all letters
	    - lowerCase = use lowercase for all letters

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks the letter case of hexadecimal literals.

ERegLiteralCheck.description: Checks for usage of EReg literals (between ~/ and /) instead of new.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for usage of EReg literals (between ~/ and /) instead of new.

NestedForDepthCheck.description: Restricts nested loop blocks to a specified depth (default = 1).

props.description: Restricts nested loop blocks to a specified depth (default = 1).

max.description:
maximum number of nested loops allowed
		setting "max" to 1 allows one inner loop

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Restricts nested loop blocks to a specified depth (default = 1).

DynamicCheck.description: Checks for use of Dynamic type anywhere in the code.

props.description: Checks for use of Dynamic type anywhere in the code.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for use of Dynamic type anywhere in the code.

UnusedImportCheck.description: Checks for unused or duplicate imports.

props.description: Checks for unused or duplicate imports.

moduleTypeMap.description:
modules that define multiple types may show up as unused, unless "moduleTypeMap" contains a mapping for it
		e.g. "haxe.macro.Expr": ["ExprDef", "ComplexType"] - would allow "import haxe.macro.Expr;" even though you just use "ComplexType"

ignoreModules.description: list of module names to ignore, any module from "ignoreModules" won't show up as unused in any file during a run

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for unused or duplicate imports.

HiddenFieldCheck.description: Checks that a local variable or a parameter does not shadow a field that is defined in the same class.

props.description: Checks that a local variable or a parameter does not shadow a field that is defined in the same class.

ignoreSetter.description: allow setters to shadow field names

ignoreConstructorParameter.description: allow constructor parameters to shadow field names

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks that a local variable or a parameter does not shadow a field that is defined in the same class.

InterfaceCheck.description: Checks and enforces interface style. Either to allow properties and methods or just methods. Has an option to `allowMarkerInterfaces`.

props.description: Checks and enforces interface style. Either to allow properties and methods or just methods. Has an option to `allowMarkerInterfaces`.

allowMarkerInterfaces.description: allows empty marker interfaces, or forbid their use

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks and enforces interface style. Either to allow properties and methods or just methods. Has an option to `allowMarkerInterfaces`.

AvoidInlineConditionalsCheck.description: Detects inline conditionals. Useful for developers who find inline conditionals hard to read and want forbid them.

props.description: Detects inline conditionals. Useful for developers who find inline conditionals hard to read and want forbid them.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Detects inline conditionals. Useful for developers who find inline conditionals hard to read and want forbid them.

props.description: Checks for public accessors.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for public accessors.

props.description: Checks correct indentation

character.description:
character sequence to use for indentation
		- "tab" for using tabs
		- a string containing as many spaces as one indentation level requires

wrapPolicy.description:
indentation of wrapped statements (= continued on next line)
		- none = wrapped statements must have the same indentation as parent
		- exact = wrapped statemenmts must have a +1 indentation in relation to parent
		- larger = wrapped statements must have a +1 or larger indentation in relation to parent

ignoreConditionals.description: ignore indentation of conditionals (same as setting conditionalPolicy to ignore)

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

conditionalPolicy.description:
indentation of conditional statements
		- ignore = ignores conditioonals, same as "ignoreConditionals"
		- fixed_zero = contitionals have to start at the beginning of a line (only where conditional is the first statement)
		- aligned = align wih surrounding code
		- aligned_increase = align wih surrounding code and increase indentation of enclosed code by +1

type.description: Checks correct indentation

CyclomaticComplexityCheck.description: Checks the complexity of methods using McCabe simplified cyclomatic complexity check. Complexity levels can be customised using `thresholds` property.

props.description: Checks the complexity of methods using McCabe simplified cyclomatic complexity check. Complexity levels can be customised using `thresholds` property.

thresholds.description: list of thresholds that define which severity level to report when complexity of method is above its limit

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks the complexity of methods using McCabe simplified cyclomatic complexity check. Complexity levels can be customised using `thresholds` property.

props.description: Checks line wrapping with operators.

option.description:
policy for wrapping token
		- eol = wrapping token should be at end of line
		- nl = wrapping token should start a new line

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks line wrapping with operators.

MethodNameCheck.description: Checks that method names conform to a format specified by the `format` property.

props.description: Checks that method names conform to a format specified by the `format` property.

items.description:
check applies to:
	- PUBLIC = all public methods
	- PRIVATE = all private methods
	- STATIC = all static methods
	- NOTSTATIC = all non static methods
	- INLINE = all inline methods
	- NOTINLINE = all non-inline methods

tokens.description: list of tokens to limit where names should conform to "format"

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks that method names conform to a format specified by the `format` property.

StringLiteralCheck.description: Checks for single or double quote string literals.

props.description: Checks for single or double quote string literals.

policy.description:
policy for string literal use
		- onlySingle = enforce single quotes
		- onlyDouble = enforce double quotes, no interpolation allowed
		- doubleAndInterpolation = enforce double quotes, allow single quotes for interpolation

allowException.description:
"allowException" allows using single quotes in "onlyDouble" and "doubleAndInterpolation" mode, when string contains a double quote character.
		Or double quotes in "onlySingle" mode when string contains a single quote character, reducing the need to escape quotation marks.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for single or double quote string literals.

ListenerNameCheck.description: Checks the naming conventions of event listener functions specified using `listeners` property.

props.description: Checks the naming conventions of event listener functions specified using `listeners` property.

listeners.description: list of function names used to register listeners

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks the naming conventions of event listener functions specified using `listeners` property.

MemberNameCheck.description: Checks that instance variable names conform to a format specified by the `format` property.

props.description: Checks that instance variable names conform to a format specified by the `format` property.

items.description:
check applies to:
	- PUBLIC = all public fields
	- PRIVATE = all private fields
	- ENUM = all enum fields
	- CLASS = all class fields, use in combination with PUBLIC and PRIVATE to only match public/private class fields
	- ABSTRACT = all abstract fields, use in combination with PUBLIC and PRIVATE to only match public/private abstract fields
	- TYPEDEF = all typedef fields

tokens.description: list of tokens to limit where names should conform to "format"

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks that instance variable names conform to a format specified by the `format` property.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

EmptyBlockCheck.description: Checks for empty blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

props.description: Checks for empty blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

tokens.description:
matches only blocks specified in tokens list:
		- CLASS_DEF = class definition "class Test {}"
		- ENUM_DEF = enum definition "enum Test {}"
		- ABSTRACT_DEF = abstract definition "abstract Test {}"
		- TYPEDEF_DEF = typdef definition "typedef Test = {}"
		- INTERFACE_DEF = interface definition "interface Test {}"
		- OBJECT_DECL = object declaration "{ x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}"
		- FUNCTION = function body "funnction test () {}"
		- FOR = for body "for (i in 0..10) {}"
		- IF = if / else body "if (test) {} else {}"
		- WHILE = while body "while (test) {}"
		- SWITCH = switch / case body "switch (test) { case: {} default: {} }"
		- TRY = try body "try {}"
		- CATCH = catch body "catch (e:Dynamic) {}"
		- REIFICATION = macro reification "$i{}"

option.description:
for all empty blocks matched by tokens
	    - empty = allow empty blocks but enforce "{}" notation
	    - text = must contain something apart from whitespace (comment or statement)
	    - stmt = must contain at least one statement (that is not a comment)

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for empty blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

ArrayAccessCheck.description: Checks for spaces before array access or inside array elements. Finds code like `a [0], a[ 0]`, etc.

props.description: Checks for spaces before array access or inside array elements. Finds code like `a [0], a[ 0]`, etc.

spaceBefore.description: set "spaceBefore" to false to detect space between array and "["

spaceInside.description: set to false to detect space between brackets ("[" + "]") and index

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for spaces before array access or inside array elements. Finds code like `a [0], a[ 0]`, etc.

ReturnCountCheck.description: Restricts the number of return statements in methods (2 by default). Ignores methods that matches `ignoreFormat` regex property.

props.description: Restricts the number of return statements in methods (2 by default). Ignores methods that matches `ignoreFormat` regex property.

max.description: maximum number of return calls a function may have

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Restricts the number of return statements in methods (2 by default). Ignores methods that matches `ignoreFormat` regex property.

NestedTryDepthCheck.description: Restricts nested `try` blocks to a specified depth (default = 1).

props.description: Restricts nested `try` blocks to a specified depth (default = 1).

max.description:
maximum number of nested try/catch statemenmts allowed
		setting "max" to 1 allows one inner try/catch

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Restricts nested `try` blocks to a specified depth (default = 1).

LeftCurlyCheck.description: Checks for the placement of left curly braces (`{`) for code blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

props.description: Checks for the placement of left curly braces (`{`) for code blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

tokens.description:
matches only left curlys specified in tokens list:
		- CLASS_DEF = class definition "class Test {}"
		- ENUM_DEF = enum definition "enum Test {}"
		- ABSTRACT_DEF = abstract definition "abstract Test {}"
		- TYPEDEF_DEF = typdef definition "typedef Test = {}"
		- INTERFACE_DEF = interface definition "interface Test {}"
		- OBJECT_DECL = object declaration "{ x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}"
		- FUNCTION = function body "funnction test () {}"
		- FOR = for body "for (i in 0..10) {}"
		- IF = if / else body "if (test) {} else {}"
		- WHILE = while body "while (test) {}"
		- SWITCH = switch / case body "switch (test) { case: {} default: {} }"
		- TRY = try body "try {}"
		- CATCH = catch body "catch (e:Dynamic) {}"
		- REIFICATION = macro reification "$i{}"
		- ARRAY_COMPREHENSION = array comprehension "[for (i in 0...10) {i * 2}]"

option.description:
placement of left curly
		- eol = should occur at end of line
	    - nl = should occur on a new line
		- nlow = should occur at end of line unless in wrapped code, then it should occur on a new line

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for the placement of left curly braces (`{`) for code blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

MagicNumberCheck.description: Checks that there are no magic numbers. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

props.description: Checks that there are no magic numbers. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

ignoreNumbers.description: list of magic numbers to ignore during checks

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks that there are no magic numbers. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

props.description: Checks that the local variable names conform to a format specified by the `format` property.

tokens.description: list of tokens to limit where names should conform to "format"

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

IndentationCharacterCheck.description: Checks indentation character (tab/space, default is tab).

props.description: Checks indentation character (tab/space, default is tab).

character.description:
set indentation to
		- tab = tab
		- space = space

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks indentation character (tab/space, default is tab).

MultipleVariableDeclarationsCheck.description: Checks that each variable declaration is in its own statement and on its own line.

props.description: Checks that each variable declaration is in its own statement and on its own line.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

MultipleStringLiteralsCheck.description: Checks for multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file. Code duplication makes maintenance more difficult, so it's better to replace the multiple occurrences with a constant.

props.description: Checks for multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file. Code duplication makes maintenance more difficult, so it's better to replace the multiple occurrences with a constant.

minLength.description: string literals must be "minLength" or more characters before including them

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file. Code duplication makes maintenance more difficult, so it's better to replace the multiple occurrences with a constant.

NullableParameterCheck.description: Enforces a style for nullable parameters.

props.description: Enforces a style for nullable parameters.

option.description:
nullable style to enforece
		- questionMark = nullable parameters should use "?name:Type"
		- nullDefault = nullable parameters should use "name:Type = null"

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Enforces a style for nullable parameters.

OperatorWhitespaceCheck.description: Checks that whitespace is present or absent around a operators.

props.description: Checks that whitespace is present or absent around a operators.

ternaryOpPolicy.description:
policy for "?:"
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

unaryOpPolicy.description:
policy for "++", "--", "!", "~"
		- inner = enforce whitespace between unary operator and operand
		- none = enforce no whitespace between unary operator and operand
		- ignore = skip checks

boolOpPolicy.description:
policy for "&&", "||"
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

intervalOpPolicy.description:
policy for "..."
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

assignOpPolicy.description:
policy for "=", "+=", "-=", "*=", "/=", "<<=", ">>=", ">>>=", "&=", "|=", "^="
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

functionArgPolicy.description:
policy for "->"
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

bitwiseOpPolicy.description:
policy for "&", "|", "^", "<<", ">>", ">>>"
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

arithmeticOpPolicy.description:
policy for "+", "-", "*", "/", "%"
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

compareOpPolicy.description:
policy for "==", "!=", "<", "<=", ">", ">="
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

arrowPolicy.description:
policy for "=>"
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks that whitespace is present or absent around a operators.

props.description: Checks for consecutive empty lines.

items.description:
empty line check supports the following places
	- afterAbstractVars = after abstract var block
	- afterClassStaticVars = after static class var block
	- afterClassVars = after class var block
	- afterImports = after all imports/usings
	- afterLeftCurly = after left curly
	- afterMultiLineComment = after multi line comment
	- afterPackage = after package
	- afterSingleLineComment = after single line comment
	- anywhereInFile = anywhere in file
	- beforePackage = before package
	- beforeRightCurly = before right curly
	- beforeUsing = before using block
	- beginAbstract = after abstract left curly
	- beginClass = after class left curly
	- beginEnum = after enum left curly
	- beforeFileEnd = before EOF
	- beginInterface = after interface left curly
	- beginTypedef = after typedef left curly
	- betweenAbstractMethods = between abstract methods
	- betweenAbstractVars = between abstract vars
	- betweenClassMethods = between class methods
	- betweenClassStaticVars = between static class vars
	- betweenClassVars = between class vars
	- betweenEnumFields = between enum fields
	- betweenImports = between imports/usings
	- betweenInterfaceFields = between interface fields
	- betweenTypedefFields = between typedef fields
	- betweenTypes = betgween two types
	- endClass = before class right curly
	- endAbstract = before abstract right curly
	- endInterface = before interface right curly
	- endEnum = before enum right curly
	- endTypedef = before typedef right curly
	- inFunction = anywhere inside function body
	- typeDefinition = between type and left curly

none.description: list of places where no empty line is permitted

items.description:
empty line check supports the following places
	- afterAbstractVars = after abstract var block
	- afterClassStaticVars = after static class var block
	- afterClassVars = after class var block
	- afterImports = after all imports/usings
	- afterLeftCurly = after left curly
	- afterMultiLineComment = after multi line comment
	- afterPackage = after package
	- afterSingleLineComment = after single line comment
	- anywhereInFile = anywhere in file
	- beforePackage = before package
	- beforeRightCurly = before right curly
	- beforeUsing = before using block
	- beginAbstract = after abstract left curly
	- beginClass = after class left curly
	- beginEnum = after enum left curly
	- beforeFileEnd = before EOF
	- beginInterface = after interface left curly
	- beginTypedef = after typedef left curly
	- betweenAbstractMethods = between abstract methods
	- betweenAbstractVars = between abstract vars
	- betweenClassMethods = between class methods
	- betweenClassStaticVars = between static class vars
	- betweenClassVars = between class vars
	- betweenEnumFields = between enum fields
	- betweenImports = between imports/usings
	- betweenInterfaceFields = between interface fields
	- betweenTypedefFields = between typedef fields
	- betweenTypes = betgween two types
	- endClass = before class right curly
	- endAbstract = before abstract right curly
	- endInterface = before interface right curly
	- endEnum = before enum right curly
	- endTypedef = before typedef right curly
	- inFunction = anywhere inside function body
	- typeDefinition = between type and left curly

upto.description: list of places where up to "max" empty lines are permitted

defaultPolicy.description: "defaultPolicy" applies to all places not in "ignore", "none", "exact", "upto" or "atleast"

items.description:
empty line check supports the following places
	- afterAbstractVars = after abstract var block
	- afterClassStaticVars = after static class var block
	- afterClassVars = after class var block
	- afterImports = after all imports/usings
	- afterLeftCurly = after left curly
	- afterMultiLineComment = after multi line comment
	- afterPackage = after package
	- afterSingleLineComment = after single line comment
	- anywhereInFile = anywhere in file
	- beforePackage = before package
	- beforeRightCurly = before right curly
	- beforeUsing = before using block
	- beginAbstract = after abstract left curly
	- beginClass = after class left curly
	- beginEnum = after enum left curly
	- beforeFileEnd = before EOF
	- beginInterface = after interface left curly
	- beginTypedef = after typedef left curly
	- betweenAbstractMethods = between abstract methods
	- betweenAbstractVars = between abstract vars
	- betweenClassMethods = between class methods
	- betweenClassStaticVars = between static class vars
	- betweenClassVars = between class vars
	- betweenEnumFields = between enum fields
	- betweenImports = between imports/usings
	- betweenInterfaceFields = between interface fields
	- betweenTypedefFields = between typedef fields
	- betweenTypes = betgween two types
	- endClass = before class right curly
	- endAbstract = before abstract right curly
	- endInterface = before interface right curly
	- endEnum = before enum right curly
	- endTypedef = before typedef right curly
	- inFunction = anywhere inside function body
	- typeDefinition = between type and left curly

exact.description: list of places where exactly "max" empty lines are required

max.description: number of empty lines to allow / enforce (used by "exact", "upto" and "atleast" policies)

items.description:
empty line check supports the following places
	- afterAbstractVars = after abstract var block
	- afterClassStaticVars = after static class var block
	- afterClassVars = after class var block
	- afterImports = after all imports/usings
	- afterLeftCurly = after left curly
	- afterMultiLineComment = after multi line comment
	- afterPackage = after package
	- afterSingleLineComment = after single line comment
	- anywhereInFile = anywhere in file
	- beforePackage = before package
	- beforeRightCurly = before right curly
	- beforeUsing = before using block
	- beginAbstract = after abstract left curly
	- beginClass = after class left curly
	- beginEnum = after enum left curly

	- beginInterface = after interface left curly
	- beginTypedef = after typedef left curly
	- betweenAbstractMethods = between abstract methods
	- betweenAbstractVars = between abstract vars
	- betweenClassMethods = between class methods
	- betweenClassStaticVars = between static class vars
	- betweenClassVars = between class vars
	- betweenEnumFields = between enum fields
	- betweenImports = between imports/usings
	- betweenInterfaceFields = between interface fields
	- betweenTypedefFields = between typedef fields
	- betweenTypes = betgween two types
	- endClass = before class right curly
	- endAbstract = before abstract right curly
	- endInterface = before interface right curly
	- endEnum = before enum right curly
	- endTypedef = before typedef right curly
	- inFunction = anywhere inside function body
	- typeDefinition = between type and left curly

	- afterAbstractVars = after abstract var block

	- afterClassVars = after class var block
	- afterImports = after all imports/usings
	- afterLeftCurly = after left curly
	- afterMultiLineComment = after multi line comment
	- afterPackage = after package

	- beforeRightCurly = before right curly
	- beforeUsing = before using block
	- beginAbstract = after abstract left curly
	- beginClass = after class left curly
	- beginEnum = after enum left curly
	- beforeFileEnd = before EOF
	- beginInterface = after interface left curly
	- beginTypedef = after typedef left curly
	- betweenAbstractMethods = between abstract methods

	- betweenClassMethods = between class methods
	- betweenClassStaticVars = between static class vars
	- betweenClassVars = between class vars
	- betweenEnumFields = between enum fields

atleast.description: list of places where at least "max" empty lines are required

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for consecutive empty lines.

extendsConfigPath.description:
Extend configuration from a master configuration file.
		Checks and excludes from both master and current configuration file form the final runtime configuration.
		There is no shadowing or overwriting checks or excludes, Checkstyle runs every check regardless where it comes from.
		A master configuration file can have its own "extendsConfigPath" entry. Checkstyle will walk up the chain as long as it does not cycle.

defineCombinations.description: different define combinations to use (on top of "baseDefines")

numberOfCheckerThreads.description: Sets the number of checker threads, valid range is 1-15

SpacingCheck.description: Spacing check on if, for, while, switch, try statements and around operators.

props.description: Spacing check on if, for, while, switch, try statements and around operators.

spaceIfCondition.description:
policy for if statements (space between "if" and "(")
		- should = require space between statement and condition
		- shouldNot = no space should between statement and condition
		- any = ignored by space check

spaceAroundBinop.description: require space around Binop operators ("+", "-", "/", etc.)

spaceForLoop.description:
policy for for statements (space between "for" and "(")
		- should = require space between statement and condition
		- shouldNot = no space should between statement and condition
		- any = ignored by space check

spaceWhileLoop.description:
policy for while statements (space between while" and "(")
		- should = require space between statement and condition
		- shouldNot = no space should between statement and condition
		- any = ignored by space check

spaceCatch.description:
policy for catch statements (space between "catch" and "(")
		- should = require space between statement and condition
		- shouldNot = no space should between statement and condition
		- any = ignored by space check

spaceSwitchCase.description:
policy for switch statements (space between "switch" and "(")
		- should = require space between statement and condition
		- shouldNot = no space should between statement and condition
		- any = ignored by space check

noSpaceAroundUnop.description: enforce no space around Unop operators ("++", "--", "!", "-", "~")

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Spacing check on if, for, while, switch, try statements and around operators.

FileLengthCheck.description: Checks for long source files. If a source file becomes very long it is hard to understand. Therefore long classes should usually be refactored into several individual classes that focus on a specific task.

max.description: maximum number of lines permitted per file (default: 2000)

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

max.description:
maximum number of nested if statements allowed
		setting "max" to 1 allows one if inside another

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:

props.description: A check for TODO/FIXME/HACK/XXX/BUG comments. The format can be customised by changing `format` property.

format.description: regex todo comment format, defaults to "^\\s*(TODO|FIXME|HACK|XXX|BUG)"

NeedBracesCheck.description: Checks for braces on function, if, for and while statements. It has an option to allow single line statements without braces using property `allowSingleLineStatement` like `if (b) return 10;`.

props.description: Checks for braces on function, if, for and while statements. It has an option to allow single line statements without braces using property `allowSingleLineStatement` like `if (b) return 10;`.

allowSingleLineStatement.description: allow / disallow use of single line statements without braces

tokens.description:
matches only statements specified in tokens list:

		- FUNCTION = function body "funnction test () {}"
		- FOR = for body "for (i in 0..10) {}"
		- IF = if body "if (test) {} else {}"
		- ELSE_IF = if body "if (test) {} else if {}"
		- WHILE = while body "while (test) {}"
		- DO_WHILE = dowhile body "do {} while (test)"
		- CATCH = catch body "catch (e:Dynamic) {}"

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for braces on function, if, for and while statements. It has an option to allow single line statements without braces using property `allowSingleLineStatement` like `if (b) return 10;`.

LineLengthCheck.description: Checks for long lines. Long lines are hard to read.

props.description: Checks for long lines. Long lines are hard to read.

max.description: maximum number of characters per line (default: 160)

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output

    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

MethodLengthCheck.description: Checks for long methods. If a method becomes very long it is hard to understand. Therefore long methods should usually be refactored into several individual methods that focus on a specific task.

props.description: Checks for long methods. If a method becomes very long it is hard to understand. Therefore long methods should usually be refactored into several individual methods that focus on a specific task.

max.description: maximum number of lines per method (default: 50)

countEmpty.description: maximum includes empty lines / should ignore empty lines

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority

SeparatorWhitespaceCheck.description: Checks that whitespace is present or absent around a separators.

props.description: Checks that whitespace is present or absent around a separators.

commaPolicy.description:
policy for ","
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

semicolonPolicy.description:
policy for ";"
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

dotPolicy.description:
policy for "."
		- around = enforce whitespace before and after operator
		- before = enforce whitespace before and no whitespace after operator
		- after = enforce no whitespace before and whitespace after operator
		- none = enforce no whitespace before and after operator
		- ignore = skip checks

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

enforce use of "public" and "private" modifiers

DefaultComesLastCheck.description: Check that the `default` is after all the cases in a `switch` statement. Haxe allows `default` anywhere within the `switch` statement. But it is more readable if it comes after the last `case`.

props.description: Check that the `default` is after all the cases in a `switch` statement. Haxe allows `default` anywhere within the `switch` statement. But it is more readable if it comes after the last `case`.

    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority

check applies to:
	- INTERFACE = all interface types
	- CLASS = all class types
	- ENUM = all enum types
	- ABSTRACT = all abstract types
	- TYPEDEF = all typedef types

ExcludeFilterList.description:
list of path filters, e.g.
	- full type names
	- names of individual folder or subfolders
	- partial folder or type names

	each line can have an additional range specification:
	- ":<linenumber>" = only matches a specific line number - valid line number start at 1
	- ":<start>-<end>" = matches line numbers from <start> to <end> (including both)
	- ":<identifier>" = matches any line or block that has <identifier> name (Haxe keywords currently unsupported)

    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for over-complicated boolean return statements.

RightCurlyCheck.description: Checks the placement of right curly braces (`}`) for code blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

props.description: Checks the placement of right curly braces (`}`) for code blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

tokens.description:
matches only right curlys specified in tokens list:
		- CLASS_DEF = class definition "class Test {}"
		- ENUM_DEF = enum definition "enum Test {}"
		- ABSTRACT_DEF = abstract definition "abstract Test {}"
		- TYPEDEF_DEF = typdef definition "typedef Test = {}"
		- INTERFACE_DEF = interface definition "interface Test {}"
		- OBJECT_DECL = object declaration "{ x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}"
		- FUNCTION = function body "funnction test () {}"
		- FOR = for body "for (i in 0..10) {}"
		- IF = if / else body "if (test) {} else {}"
		- WHILE = while body "while (test) {}"
		- SWITCH = switch / case body "switch (test) { case: {} default: {} }"
		- TRY = try body "try {}"
		- CATCH = catch body "catch (e:Dynamic) {}"
		- REIFICATION = macro reification "$i{}"
		- ARRAY_COMPREHENSION = array comprehension "[for (i in 0...10) {i * 2}]"

option.description:
placement of right curly
		- same = right curly must be alone on a new line, except for "} else" and "} catch"
		- alone = alone on a new line
		- aloneorsingle = right curly can occur on same line as left curly or must be alone on a new line

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks the placement of right curly braces (`}`) for code blocks. The policy to verify is specified using the property `option`.

ReturnCheck.description: Warns if Void is used for return or if return type is not specified when returning.

props.description: Warns if Void is used for return or if return type is not specified when returning.

enforceReturnTypeForAnonymous.description: enforces return type for anonymous functions

allowEmptyReturn.description: allows empty return which is mostly used to exit functions.

enforceReturnType.description: enforces return type for every function

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Warns if Void is used for return or if return type is not specified when returning.

ExcludeConfig.description: defines filters to exclude folders, types or files from all or specific checks

path.description:
filters excludes relative to
	- RELATIVE_TO_PROJECT = use project root
	- RELATIVE_TO_SOURCE = use path(s) specified via "-s <path>" command line switches

all.description: exclude matching files from all checks

ConditionalCompilationCheck.description: Checks placement and indentation of conditional compilation flags.

props.description: Checks placement and indentation of conditional compilation flags.

policy.description:
indentation of conditional statements
	    - startOfLine = #if, #else, #elseif and #end must start at beginning of line
	    - aligned = indentation of #if, #else, #elseif and #end must match surrounding code

		Both "aligned" and "startOfLine" will produce a message if conditional compilation flags are not on a separate line.
		All #else, #elseif and #end flags must have the same indentation as their corresponding #if.

allowSingleline.description: allows or prevents using single line conditional compilation flags.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks placement and indentation of conditional compilation flags.

WhitespaceAfterCheck.description: Checks for whitespace after a token.

props.description: Checks for whitespace after a token.

severity.description:
sets gravity of reported violations:
    - IGNORE = do not report violations, violations do not appear anywhere in output
    - INFO = all violations have info / lowest priority
    - WARNING = all violations have warning / medium priority
    - ERROR = all violations have error / highest priority

type.description: Checks for whitespace after a token.
